00046 typedef unsigned long long rthal_time_t;
00047 
00048 #define __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l) ({          \
00049     unsigned long long _ull = (ull);            \
00050     (l) = _ull & 0xffffffff;                    \
00051     (h) = _ull >> 32;                           \
00052 })
00053 
00054 #define __rthal_u64fromu32(h, l) ({             \
00055     unsigned long long _ull;                    \
00056     asm ( "": "=A"(_ull) : "d"(h), "a"(l));     \
00057     _ull;                                       \
00058 })
00059 
00060 /* Fast longs multiplication. */
00061 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long long
00062 rthal_ullmul(unsigned long m1, unsigned long m2) {
00063     /* Gcc (at least for versions 2.95 and higher) optimises correctly here. */
00064     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00065 }
00066 
00067 /* const helper for rthal_uldivrem, so that the compiler will eliminate
00068    multiple calls with same arguments, at no additionnal cost. */
00069 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long long
00070 __rthal_uldivrem(const unsigned long long ull, const unsigned long d) {
00071 
00072     unsigned long long ret;
00073     __asm__ ("divl %1" : "=A,A"(ret) : "r,?m"(d), "A,A"(ull));
00074     /* Exception if quotient does not fit on unsigned long. */
00075     return ret;
00076 }
00077 
00078 static inline __attribute_const__ int rthal_imuldiv (const int i,
00079                                                      const int mult,
00080                                                      const int div) {
00081 
00082     /* Returns (unsigned)i =
00083                (unsigned long long)i*(unsigned)(mult)/(unsigned)div. */
00084     const unsigned long ui = (const unsigned long) i;
00085     const unsigned long um = (const unsigned long) mult;
00086     return __rthal_uldivrem((const unsigned long long) ui * um, div);
00087 }
00088 
00089 /* Fast long long division: when the quotient and remainder fit on 32 bits.
00090    Recent compilers remove redundant calls to this function. */
00091 static inline unsigned long rthal_uldivrem(unsigned long long ull,
00092                                            const unsigned long d,
00093                                            unsigned long *const rp) {
00094 
00095     unsigned long q, r;
00096     ull = __rthal_uldivrem(ull, d);
00097     __asm__ ( "": "=d"(r), "=a"(q) : "A"(ull));
00098     if(rp)
00099         *rp = r;
00100     return q;
00101 }
00102 
00103 
00104 /* Division of an unsigned 96 bits ((h << 32) + l) by an unsigned 32 bits.
00105    Common building block for ulldiv and llimd. */
00106 static inline unsigned long long __rthal_div96by32 (const unsigned long long h,
00107                                                     const unsigned long l,
00108                                                     const unsigned long d,
00109                                                     unsigned long *const rp) {
00110 
00111     u_long rh;
00112     const u_long qh = rthal_uldivrem(h, d, &rh);
00113     const unsigned long long t = __rthal_u64fromu32(rh, l);
00114     const u_long ql = rthal_uldivrem(t, d, rp);
00115 
00116     return __rthal_u64fromu32(qh, ql);
00117 }
00118 
00119 
00120 /* Slow long long division. Uses rthal_uldivrem, hence has the same property:
00121    the compiler removes redundant calls. */
00122 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (const unsigned long long ull,
00123                                                const unsigned long d,
00124                                                unsigned long *const rp) {
00125 
00126     unsigned long h, l;
00127     __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l);
00128     return __rthal_div96by32(h, l, d, rp);
00129 }
00130 
00131 /* Replaced the helper with rthal_ulldiv. */
00132 #define rthal_u64div32c rthal_ulldiv
00133 
00134 static inline __attribute_const__
00135 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00136                                    const unsigned long m,
00137                                    const unsigned long d) {
00138 
00139     unsigned long long th, tl;
00140     u_long oph, opl, tlh, tll;
00141 
00142     __rthal_u64tou32(op, oph, opl);
00143     tl = (unsigned long long) opl * m;
00144     __rthal_u64tou32(tl, tlh, tll);
00145     th = (unsigned long long) oph * m;
00146     /* op * m == ((th + tlh) << 32) + tll */
00147 
00148     __asm__ (  "addl %1, %%eax\n\t"
00149                "adcl $0, %%edx"
00150                : "=A,A"(th)
00151                : "r,?m"(tlh), "A,A"(th) );
00152     /* op * m == (th << 32) + tll */
00153 
00154     return __rthal_div96by32(th, tll, d, NULL);
00155 }
00156 
00157 static inline __attribute_const__ long long rthal_llimd (const long long op,
00158                                                          const unsigned long m,
00159                                                          const unsigned long d) {
00160 
00161     if(op < 0LL)
00162         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00163     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00164 }
00165 
00166 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00167     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00168     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00169             : "=r,r" (word)
00170             : "r,?m"  (word));
00171     return word;
00172 }

00231 #define rthal_sti()                     adeos_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)

00252 static inline void rthal_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00253 
00254     rthal_cli();
00255     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00256 }
00257 
00258 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00259 
00260     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00261     rthal_sti();
00262 }

00264 static inline unsigned long rthal_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00265 
00266     unsigned long flags;
00267     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00268     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00269     return flags;
00270 }

00272 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00273                                                 spinlock_t *lock) {
00274     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00275     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags);

00278 #if !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00279 
00280 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI
00281    domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task address
00282    using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack pointer
00283    instead. */
00284 
00285 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00286     return ((struct thread_info *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~8191UL)))->task;
00287 }
00288 
00289 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid)
00290 
00291 {
00292     int *esp;
00293 
00294     __asm__ ("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r,?m" (esp));
00295 
00296     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048)
00297         return rthal_get_root_current(cpuid);
00298 
00299     return get_current();
00300 }
00301 
00302 #else /* CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00303 
00304 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00305     return current;
00306 }
00307 
00308 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid) {
00309     return current;
00310 }
00311 
00312 #endif /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00314 static inline void rthal_set_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00315 
00316     if (delay) {
00317         unsigned long flags;
00318         rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00319 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00320         apic_read(APIC_LVTT);
00321         apic_write_around(APIC_LVTT,RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_VECTOR);
00322         apic_read(APIC_TMICT);
00323         apic_write_around(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00324 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00325         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00326         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00327 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00328         rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00329     }
00330 }
